title: Allan Ramsay,
author: Smeaton, William Henry Oliphant
snippet: This valuable repository of much that otherwise would have perished was lent to Ramsay by the Hon. William Carmichael of Skirling, advocate (brother to the Earl of Hyndford), with permission to extract what he required.

title: A selection from the correspondence of the late Thomas Chalmers /
author: Chalmers, Thomas

title: A selection from the correspondence of the late Thomas Chalmers /
author: Chalmers, Thomas
snippet: There is, upon that occasion, ageneral convergence toward our house of the iraraediate re-lationhood ; and I look for the families both of Skirling andDunkeld shortly.

title: A selection from the correspondence of the late Thomas Chalmers /
author: Chalmers, Thomas
snippet: She is now at Castlebank, and proposes to go to Wishaw and Skirling.

title: A selection from the correspondence of the late Thomas Chalmers /
author: Chalmers, Thomas
snippet: She is with me hereat Skirling, as well as Mrs. Chalmers, and I hope that bothof them will benefit by the change of air.

title: Waverley Novels. (Abbotsford edition.)
author: Scott, Walter
snippet: — " What should I get by slaying this inso-lent soldier ? — Were it the Constable Saint Pauliudeed"— Here he paused, as if he thought he hadsaid a word too much, but resumed, laughing," There's our brother-in-law, James of Scotland —your own James, Quentin—poniarded the Douglaswhen on a hospitable visit, within his own royalcastle of Skirling."
